info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 2:01PM PST until December 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches above 5000 feet and 7 to 12 inches above 6500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lincoln County and Esmeralda and Central Nye County. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...US-95 between Tonopah and Beatty will be impacted with heavy snow. Additional roadways affected include Highway 6 and Highway 264 in Esmeralda County including Dyer, as well as Goldfield Summit. Additionally, heavy snow is likely in the higher elevations of the Nevada National Security Site in Nye county. Snow level may fluctuate between 5000 and 6000 feet during the day Tuesday across Lincoln County and eastern Nye County, with snow levels falling again Tuesday evening. US-93 Between Pioche and Caliente will observe areas heavy snow as well as Coyote Springs Summit. SR-319 and Eagle Valley Road will also be impacted.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
